title: match type inference problem
body:
```
fn foo1(x: i32) -> u32 {
    let aux = match x {
        0 => 10,
        1 => 20,
        2 => 30,
        _ => unreachable!(),
    };
    aux * 10
}

fn foo2(x: i32) -> u32 {
    match x {
        0 => 10,
        1 => 20,
        2 => 30,
        _ => unreachable!(),
    } * 10u32
}

fn main() {}
```

The last Nightly gives:

```
error[E0308]: match arms have incompatible types
  --> ...\test.rs:12:5
   |
12 | /     match x {
13 | |         0 => 10,
14 | |         1 => 20,
15 | |         2 => 30,
16 | |         _ => unreachable!(),
   | |              -------------- match arm with an incompatible type
17 | |     } * 10u32
   | |_____^ expected integral variable, found ()
   |
   = note: expected type `{integer}`
              found type `()`
   = note: this error originates in a macro outside of the current crate (in Nightly builds, run with -Z external-macro-backtrace for more info)

error[E0614]: type `u32` cannot be dereferenced
  --> ...\test.rs:17:7
   |
17 |     } * 10u32
   |       ^^^^^^^

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

Some errors occurred: E0308, E0614.
For more information about an error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.



rustc 1.30.0-nightly (2ab3eba30 2018-09-14)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 2ab3eba30741652ba538bc2fc2bba9d81a5c84c6
commit-date: 2018-09-14
host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
release: 1.30.0-nightly
LLVM version: 8.0

```
